dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
label: copy number (gistic2)
description:
TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline applied GISTIC2 method to produce segmented CNV data, which was then mapped to genes to produce gene-level estimates. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) copy number gistic2 estimate
name: TCGA_LGG_gistic2

dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: exon expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The exon expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the exon-level transcription estimates, as in RPKM values (Reads Per Kilobase of exon model per Million mapped reads). Exons are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena unc_RNAseq_exon probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details. Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) exon expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_LGG_exp_HiSeqV2_exon

dataProducer: Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Center
label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (broad automated)
description:
TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) somatic mutation data. Sequencing data are generated on a IlluminaGA system. The calls are generated at Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Center using the MuTect method.

Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs, change of start codon, inframe indels) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

name: TCGA_LGG_mutation_broad_gene

dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
dataType: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) gene expression by RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq), pancan normalized
name: TCGA_LGG_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_LGG_hMethyl450

process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into cgData repository

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into cgData repository
dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: copy number (delete germline cnv)
description:
TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) segmented copy number variation profile after removing common germline copy number variation.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix Genome-Wide Human SNP Array 6.0 platform at the Broad TCGA genome characterization center. Raw copy numbers were estimated at each of the SNP and copy-number markers. Circular binary segmentation was then used to segment the copy number data. Segments are mapped to hg19 genome assembly at Broad. A fixed set of common germline cnv probes were removed prior to segmentation. Reference to the algorithm used by Broad to produce the dataset: DCC description and nature 2008 .
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) segmented copy number (delete germline cnv)
name: TCGA_LGG_GSNP6noCNV

dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
unit: -2,-1,0,1,2: 2 copy del, 1 copy del, no change, amplification, high-amplification
label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_LGG_gistic2thd

dataProducer: TCGA PANCAN AWG
label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (pancan awg)
description:
TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) somatic mutation data. Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

Somatic mutations calls (even on the same tumor DNA extract) are affected by many factors including library prep, sequencing process, read mapping method, reference genome used, genome annotation, calling algorithms, and ad-hoc pre/postprocessing such as black list genes, target selection regions, and black list samples. This dataset is the best effort made by the TCGA PANCANCER Analysis Working Group. Raw PANCAN mutation data can be downloaded at the url site shown below.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) gene-level non-silent somatic mutation (pancan awg)
name: TCGA_LGG_mutation

dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_LGG_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

The miRNA expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the British Columbia Cancer Agency TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. Download data is in the unit of reads per million mapped reads (RPM). dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
dataType: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_ACC_hMethyl450

dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: copy number (delete germline cnv)
description:
TCGA adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) segmented copy number variation profile after removing common germline copy number variation.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix Genome-Wide Human SNP Array 6.0 platform at the Broad TCGA genome characterization center. Raw copy numbers were estimated at each of the SNP and copy-number markers. Circular binary segmentation was then used to segment the copy number data. Segments are mapped to hg19 genome assembly at Broad. A fixed set of common germline cnv probes were removed prior to segmentation. Reference to the algorithm used by Broad to produce the dataset: DCC description and nature 2008 .
longTitle: TCGA adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) segmented copy number (delete germline cnv)
name: TCGA_ACC_GSNP6noCNV

dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
unit: -2,-1,0,1,2: 2 copy del, 1 copy del, no change, amplification, high-amplification
label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_ACC_gistic2thd

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA kidney renal papillary cell carcinoma (KIRP) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA kidney renal papillary cell carcinoma (KIRP) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_KIRP_hMethyl450

unit: -2,-1,0,1,2: 2 copy del, 1 copy del, no change, amplification, high-amplification
label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA kidney renal papillary cell carcinoma (KIRP) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA kidney renal papillary cell carcinoma (KIRP) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_KIRP_gistic2thd

dataProducer: TCGA PANCAN AWG
label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (pancan awg)
description:
TCGA kidney renal papillary cell carcinoma (KIRP) somatic mutation data. Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

Somatic mutations calls (even on the same tumor DNA extract) are affected by many factors including library prep, sequencing process, read mapping method, reference genome used, genome annotation, calling algorithms, and ad-hoc pre/postprocessing such as black list genes, target selection regions, and black list samples. This dataset is the best effort made by the TCGA PANCANCER Analysis Working Group. Raw PANCAN mutation data can be downloaded at the url site shown below.
longTitle: TCGA kidney renal papillary cell carcinoma (KIRP) gene-level non-silent somatic mutation (pancan awg)
name: TCGA_KIRP_mutation

label: DNA methylation (Methylation27k)
description:
TCGA kidney renal papillary cell carcinoma (KIRP) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation27 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. The average of the beta values of this dataset is 0.258881800662., thus much of the heatmap appears hypomethylated (blue). Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL8490 and GPL13534 records. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.

dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA kidney renal papillary cell carcinoma (KIRP) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_KIRP_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_LUAD_hMethyl450

dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: copy number (delete germline cnv)
description:
TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) segmented copy number variation profile after removing common germline copy number variation.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix Genome-Wide Human SNP Array 6.0 platform at the Broad TCGA genome characterization center. Raw copy numbers were estimated at each of the SNP and copy-number markers. Circular binary segmentation was then used to segment the copy number data. Segments are mapped to hg19 genome assembly at Broad. A fixed set of common germline cnv probes were removed prior to segmentation. Reference to the algorithm used by Broad to produce the dataset: DCC description and nature 2008 .
longTitle: TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) segmented copy number (delete germline cnv)
name: TCGA_LUAD_GSNP6noCNV

dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
unit: -2,-1,0,1,2: 2 copy del, 1 copy del, no change, amplification, high-amplification
label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_LUAD_gistic2thd

dataProducer: TCGA PANCAN AWG
label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (pancan awg)
description:
TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) somatic mutation data. Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

Somatic mutations calls (even on the same tumor DNA extract) are affected by many factors including library prep, sequencing process, read mapping method, reference genome used, genome annotation, calling algorithms, and ad-hoc pre/postprocessing such as black list genes, target selection regions, and black list samples. This dataset is the best effort made by the TCGA PANCANCER Analysis Working Group. Raw PANCAN mutation data can be downloaded at the url site shown below.
longTitle: TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) gene-level non-silent somatic mutation (pancan awg)
name: TCGA_LUAD_mutation

label: DNA methylation (Methylation27k)
description:
TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation27 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. The average of the beta values of this dataset is 0.262028528914., thus much of the heatmap appears hypomethylated (blue). process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_LUAD_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix Genome-Wide Human SNP Array 6.0 platform at the Broad TCGA genome characterization center. Raw copy numbers were estimated at each of the SNP and copy-number markers. Circular binary segmentation was then used to segment the copy number data. Segments are mapped to hg19 genome assembly at Broad. A fixed set of common germline cnv probes were removed prior to segmentation. Reference to the algorithm used by Broad to produce the dataset: DCC description and nature 2008 .
longTitle: TCGA bladder urothelial carcinoma (BLCA) segmented copy number (delete germline cnv)
name: TCGA_BLCA_GSNP6noCNV_gSeg

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA bladder urothelial carcinoma (BLCA) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. dataProducer: TCGA PANCAN AWG
label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (pancan awg)
description:
TCGA bladder urothelial carcinoma (BLCA) somatic mutation data. Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

Somatic mutations calls (even on the same tumor DNA extract) are affected by many factors including library prep, sequencing process, read mapping method, reference genome used, genome annotation, calling algorithms, and ad-hoc pre/postprocessing such as black list genes, target selection regions, and black list samples. This dataset is the best effort made by the TCGA PANCANCER Analysis Working Group. Raw PANCAN mutation data can be downloaded at the url site shown below.
longTitle: TCGA bladder urothelial carcinoma (BLCA) gene-level non-silent somatic mutation (pancan awg)
name: TCGA_BLCA_mutation

dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA bladder urothelial carcinoma (BLCA) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_BLCA_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. Download data is in the unit of reads per million mapped reads (RPM). dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA uveal melanoma (UVM) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA uveal melanoma (UVM) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_UVM_hMethyl450

Segments are mapped to hg19 genome assembly at Broad. Reference to the algorithm used by Broad to produce the dataset: DCC description and nature 2008 .

process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA uveal melanoma (UVM) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_UVM_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. Download data is in the unit of reads per million mapped reads (RPM). This dataset shows the miRNA transcription estimates in log2 (RPM). For more information see: http://nar.oxfordjournals.org/content/early/2015/08/13/nar.gkv808.full .

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each miRNA to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each miRNA across the cohort on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA uveal melanoma (UVM) miRNA isoform expression by RNAseq (IlluminaHiseq)
name: TCGA_UVM_miRNA_HiSeq

process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA sarcoma (SARC) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA sarcoma (SARC) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_SARC_hMethyl450

label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA sarcoma (SARC) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA sarcoma (SARC) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate

label: miRNA isoform expression (IlluminaHiseq)
description:
TCGA sarcoma (SARC) miRNA expression by RNAseq. The miRNA expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the British Columbia Cancer Agency TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. Download data is in the unit of reads per million mapped reads (RPM). This dataset shows the miRNA transcription estimates in log2 (RPM). For more information see: http://nar.oxfordjournals.org/content/early/2015/08/13/nar.gkv808.full .

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each miRNA to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each miRNA across the cohort on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA sarcoma (SARC) miRNA isoform expression by RNAseq (IlluminaHiseq)
name: TCGA_SARC_miRNA_HiSeq

dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA acute myeloid leukemia (LAML) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
dataType: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA acute myeloid leukemia (LAML) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA acute myeloid leukemia (LAML) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_LAML_hMethyl450

dataProducer: Genome Institute at Washington University Sequencing Center
label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (wustl)
gdata_tags: Genome Institute at Washington University Sequencing Center
description:
TCGA acute myeloid leukemia (LAML) somatic mutation data. Sequencing data are generated on a IlluminaGA system. The calls are generated at Genome Institute at Washington University Sequencing Center using the WashU pipeline method.

Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs, change of start codon, inframe indels) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

name: TCGA_LAML_mutation_wustl_gene

dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
unit: -2,-1,0,1,2: 2 copy del, 1 copy del, no change, amplification, high-amplification
label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA acute myeloid leukemia (LAML) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA acute myeloid leukemia (LAML) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_LAML_gistic2thd

dataProducer: TCGA PANCAN AWG
label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (pancan awg)
description:
TCGA acute myeloid leukemia (LAML) somatic mutation data. Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

Somatic mutations calls (even on the same tumor DNA extract) are affected by many factors including library prep, sequencing process, read mapping method, reference genome used, genome annotation, calling algorithms, and ad-hoc pre/postprocessing such as black list genes, target selection regions, and black list samples. This dataset is the best effort made by the TCGA PANCANCER Analysis Working Group. Raw PANCAN mutation data can be downloaded at the url site shown below.

label: DNA methylation (Methylation27k)
description:
TCGA acute myeloid leukemia (LAML) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation27 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. The average of the beta values of this dataset is 0.281687524959., thus much of the heatmap appears hypomethylated (blue). Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL8490 and GPL13534 records. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.

dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: gene expression (AffyU133a)
description:
TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) gene expression data by AffyU133a array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix HT Human Genome U133a microarray platform by the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates. Data is in log space. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) gene expression (AffyU133a array)
name: TCGA_GBM_exp_u133a

dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
dataType: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

name: TCGA_GBM_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_GBM_hMethyl450

dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: copy number (delete germline cnv)
description:
TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) segmented copy number variation profile after removing common germline copy number variation.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix Genome-Wide Human SNP Array 6.0 platform at the Broad TCGA genome characterization center. Raw copy numbers were estimated at each of the SNP and copy-number markers. Circular binary segmentation was then used to segment the copy number data. Segments are mapped to hg19 genome assembly at Broad. A fixed set of common germline cnv probes were removed prior to segmentation. Reference to the algorithm used by Broad to produce the dataset: DCC description and nature 2008 .
longTitle: TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) segmented copy number (delete germline cnv)
name: TCGA_GBM_GSNP6noCNV

label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_GBM_gistic2thd

label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (pancan awg)
description:
TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) somatic mutation data. Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

Somatic mutations calls (even on the same tumor DNA extract) are affected by many factors including library prep, sequencing process, read mapping method, reference genome used, genome annotation, calling algorithms, and ad-hoc pre/postprocessing such as black list genes, target selection regions, and black list samples. This dataset is the best effort made by the TCGA PANCANCER Analysis Working Group. Raw PANCAN mutation data can be downloaded at the url site shown below.

dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation27k)
description:
TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation27 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. The average of the beta values of this dataset is 0.262291434589., thus much of the heatmap appears hypomethylated (blue). Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL8490 and GPL13534 records. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation27)
name: TCGA_GBM_hMethyl27

Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.

Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA colon & rectum adenocarcinoma (COADREAD) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_COADREAD_gistic2thd

dataProducer: TCGA PANCAN AWG
label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (pancan awg)
description:
TCGA colon & rectum adenocarcinoma (COADREAD) somatic mutation data. Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

Somatic mutations calls (even on the same tumor DNA extract) are affected by many factors including library prep, sequencing process, read mapping method, reference genome used, genome annotation, calling algorithms, and ad-hoc pre/postprocessing such as black list genes, target selection regions, and black list samples. This dataset is the best effort made by the TCGA PANCANCER Analysis Working Group. Raw PANCAN mutation data can be downloaded at the url site shown below.
longTitle: TCGA colon & rectum adenocarcinoma (COADREAD) gene-level non-silent somatic mutation (pancan awg)
name: TCGA_COADREAD_mutation

label: DNA methylation (Methylation27k)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA colon adenocarcinoma and rectum adenocarcinoma datasets. TCGA colon & rectum adenocarcinoma (COADREAD) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation27 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. The average of the beta values of this dataset is 0.259820135655., thus much of the heatmap appears hypomethylated (blue). Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL8490 and GPL13534 records. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA colon & rectum adenocarcinoma (COADREAD) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation27)
name: TCGA_COADREAD_hMethyl27

label: gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA colon adenocarcinoma and rectum adenocarcinoma datasets. TCGA colon & rectum adenocarcinoma (COADREAD) gene expression data by agilent array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using Agilent 244K custom gene expression G4502A_07_3 microarrays by the University of North Carolina TCGA genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene level transcription estimates (level 3 data), as in log2 lowess normalized ratio of sample signal to reference signal (cy5/cy3) collapsed by gene. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA colon & rectum adenocarcinoma (COADREAD) gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3 array)
name: TCGA_COADREAD_G4502A_07_3

label: copy number (delete germline cnv)
description:
TCGA uterine carcinosarcoma (UCS) segmented copy number variation profile after removing common germline copy number variation.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix Genome-Wide Human SNP Array 6.0 platform at the Broad TCGA genome characterization center. Raw copy numbers were estimated at each of the SNP and copy-number markers. Circular binary segmentation was then used to segment the copy number data. Segments are mapped to hg19 genome assembly at Broad. A fixed set of common germline cnv probes were removed prior to segmentation. Reference to the algorithm used by Broad to produce the dataset: DCC description and nature 2008 .

name: TCGA_UCS_GSNP6noCNV

TCGA mesothelioma (MESO) gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline applied GISTIC2 method to produce segmented CNV data, which was then mapped to genes to produce gene-level estimates. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA mesothelioma (MESO) copy number gistic2 estimate
name: TCGA_MESO_gistic2

Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA mesothelioma (MESO) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA mesothelioma (MESO) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_MESO_hMethyl450

dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: copy number (delete germline cnv)
description:
TCGA mesothelioma (MESO) segmented copy number variation profile after removing common germline copy number variation.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix Genome-Wide Human SNP Array 6.0 platform at the Broad TCGA genome characterization center. Raw copy numbers were estimated at each of the SNP and copy-number markers. Circular binary segmentation was then used to segment the copy number data. Segments are mapped to hg19 genome assembly at Broad. A fixed set of common germline cnv probes were removed prior to segmentation. Reference to the algorithm used by Broad to produce the dataset: DCC description and nature 2008 .
longTitle: TCGA mesothelioma (MESO) segmented copy number (delete germline cnv)
name: TCGA_MESO_GSNP6noCNV

dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
unit: -2,-1,0,1,2: 2 copy del, 1 copy del, no change, amplification, high-amplification
label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA mesothelioma (MESO) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA mesothelioma (MESO) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_MESO_gistic2thd

DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA rectum adenocarcinoma (READ) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_READ_hMethyl450

label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA rectum adenocarcinoma (READ) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation27k)
description:
TCGA rectum adenocarcinoma (READ) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation27 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. The average of the beta values of this dataset is 0.253446269828., thus much of the heatmap appears hypomethylated (blue). Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL8490 and GPL13534 records. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA rectum adenocarcinoma (READ) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation27)
name: TCGA_READ_hMethyl27

process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA rectum adenocarcinoma (READ) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_READ_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

description:
Five3 Genomics PARADIGM pathway IPLs (integrated pathway levels) using RNAseq and copy number data. The RNAseq data is the platform-corrected PANCAN12 dataset from UNC. Genes were median-centered. The CNV data is SNP6 data from Broad Inst, removed germline cnvs. The pathways used in this analysis are from a version of the SuperPathway developed by Five3 Genomics. Detail: https://www.synapse.org/#!Synapse:syn1695423.

PARADIGM (PMID 20529912) is pathway analysis method to infer tumor sample-specific genetic activities by incorporating curated pathway interactions as well as integrating diverse types of genomic data.
