label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (pancan awg 19 cohorts)
description:
TCGA pan-cancer (PANCAN) somatic mutation data. Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

Somatic mutations calls (even on the same tumor DNA extract) are affected by many factors including library prep, sequencing process, read mapping method, reference genome used, genome annotation, calling algorithms, and ad-hoc pre/postprocessing such as black list genes, target selection regions, and black list samples. This dataset is the best effort made by the TCGA PANCANCER Analysis Working Group. Raw PANCAN mutation data can be downloaded at the url site shown below.
dataType: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (pancan awg 19 cohorts)

Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs, change of start codon, inframe indels) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. TCGA cholangiocarcinoma (CHOL) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA cholangiocarcinoma (CHOL) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA cholangiocarcinoma (CHOL) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_CHOL_hMethyl450

dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: copy number (delete germline cnv)
description:
TCGA cholangiocarcinoma (CHOL) segmented copy number variation profile after removing common germline copy number variation.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix Genome-Wide Human SNP Array 6.0 platform at the Broad TCGA genome characterization center. Raw copy numbers were estimated at each of the SNP and copy-number markers. Circular binary segmentation was then used to segment the copy number data. Segments are mapped to hg19 genome assembly at Broad. A fixed set of common germline cnv probes were removed prior to segmentation. Reference to the algorithm used by Broad to produce the dataset: DCC description and nature 2008 .
longTitle: TCGA cholangiocarcinoma (CHOL) segmented copy number (delete germline cnv)
name: TCGA_CHOL_GSNP6noCNV

unit: -2,-1,0,1,2: 2 copy del, 1 copy del, no change, amplification, high-amplification
label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA cholangiocarcinoma (CHOL) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA cholangiocarcinoma (CHOL) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_CHOL_gistic2thd

Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.

label: copy number segments (delete germline cnv)
description:
TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) segmented copy number variation profile after removing common germline copy number variation.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix Genome-Wide Human SNP Array 6.0 platform at the Broad TCGA genome characterization center. Raw copy numbers were estimated at each of the SNP and copy-number markers. Circular binary segmentation was then used to segment the copy number data. label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_BRCA_gistic2thd

dataProducer: TCGA PANCAN AWG
label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (pancan awg)
description:
TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) somatic mutation data. Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

Somatic mutations calls (even on the same tumor DNA extract) are affected by many factors including library prep, sequencing process, read mapping method, reference genome used, genome annotation, calling algorithms, and ad-hoc pre/postprocessing such as black list genes, target selection regions, and black list samples. This dataset is the best effort made by the TCGA PANCANCER Analysis Working Group. Raw PANCAN mutation data can be downloaded at the url site shown below.
longTitle: TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) gene-level non-silent somatic mutation (pancan awg)
name: TCGA_BRCA_mutation

process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation27k)
description:
TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation27 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. The average of the beta values of this dataset is 0.265349324821., thus much of the heatmap appears hypomethylated (blue). Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL8490 and GPL13534 records. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation27)
name: TCGA_BRCA_hMethyl27

process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_BRCA_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

dataProducer: British Columbia Cancer Agency TCGA genome characterization center
label: miRNA isoform expression (IlluminaHiseq)
description:
TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) miRNA expression by RNAseq. The miRNA expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the British Columbia Cancer Agency TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. Download data is in the unit of reads per million mapped reads (RPM). This dataset shows the miRNA transcription estimates in log2 (RPM). For more information see: http://nar.oxfordjournals.org/content/early/2015/08/13/nar.gkv808.full .

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each miRNA to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each miRNA across the cohort on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) miRNA isoform expression by RNAseq (IlluminaHiseq)
name: TCGA_BRCA_miRNA_HiSeq

Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

Somatic mutations calls (even on the same tumor DNA extract) are affected by many factors including library prep, sequencing process, read mapping method, reference genome used, genome annotation, calling algorithms, and ad-hoc pre/postprocessing such as black list genes, target selection regions, and black list samples. This dataset is the best effort made by the TCGA PANCANCER Analysis Working Group. Raw PANCAN mutation data can be downloaded at the url site shown below.
longTitle: TCGA skin cutaneous melanoma (SKCM) gene-level non-silent somatic mutation (pancan awg)
name: TCGA_SKCM_mutation

dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA skin cutaneous melanoma (SKCM) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_SKCM_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. Download data is in the unit of reads per million mapped reads (RPM). dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA prostate adenocarcinoma (PRAD) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA prostate adenocarcinoma (PRAD) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_PRAD_hMethyl450

dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
unit: -2,-1,0,1,2: 2 copy del, 1 copy del, no change, amplification, high-amplification
label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA prostate adenocarcinoma (PRAD) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA prostate adenocarcinoma (PRAD) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_PRAD_gistic2thd

label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA liver hepatocellular carcinoma (LIHC) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA liver hepatocellular carcinoma (LIHC) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA liver hepatocellular carcinoma (LIHC) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_LIHC_hMethyl450

dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: copy number (delete germline cnv)
description:
TCGA liver hepatocellular carcinoma (LIHC) segmented copy number variation profile after removing common germline copy number variation.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix Genome-Wide Human SNP Array 6.0 platform at the Broad TCGA genome characterization center. Raw copy numbers were estimated at each of the SNP and copy-number markers. Circular binary segmentation was then used to segment the copy number data. Segments are mapped to hg19 genome assembly at Broad. A fixed set of common germline cnv probes were removed prior to segmentation. Reference to the algorithm used by Broad to produce the dataset: DCC description and nature 2008 .
longTitle: TCGA liver hepatocellular carcinoma (LIHC) segmented copy number (delete germline cnv)
name: TCGA_LIHC_GSNP6noCNV

Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_LUNG_gistic2thd

label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (pancan awg)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) somatic mutation data. Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

Somatic mutations calls (even on the same tumor DNA extract) are affected by many factors including library prep, sequencing process, read mapping method, reference genome used, genome annotation, calling algorithms, and ad-hoc pre/postprocessing such as black list genes, target selection regions, and black list samples. This dataset is the best effort made by the TCGA PANCANCER Analysis Working Group. Raw PANCAN mutation data can be downloaded at the url site shown below.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene-level non-silent somatic mutation (pancan awg)
name: TCGA_LUNG_mutation

label: DNA methylation (Methylation27k)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation27 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. The average of the beta values of this dataset is 0.242421397836., thus much of the heatmap appears hypomethylated (blue). Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL8490 and GPL13534 records. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation27)
name: TCGA_LUNG_hMethyl27

label: gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene expression data by agilent array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using Agilent 244K custom gene expression G4502A_07_3 microarrays by the University of North Carolina TCGA genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene level transcription estimates (level 3 data), as in log2 lowess normalized ratio of sample signal to reference signal (cy5/cy3) collapsed by gene. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3 array)
name: TCGA_LUNG_G4502A_07_3

dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_HNSC_hMethyl450
groupTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into cgData repository
dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: copy number (delete germline cnv)
description:
TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) segmented copy number variation profile after removing common germline copy number variation.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix Genome-Wide Human SNP Array 6.0 platform at the Broad TCGA genome characterization center. Raw copy numbers were estimated at each of the SNP and copy-number markers. Circular binary segmentation was then used to segment the copy number data. Segments are mapped to hg19 genome assembly at Broad. A fixed set of common germline cnv probes were removed prior to segmentation. Reference to the algorithm used by Broad to produce the dataset: DCC description and nature 2008 .

name: TCGA_HNSC_GSNP6noCNV

dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.

process.unit: -2,-1,0,1,2: 2 copy del, 1 copy del, no change, amplification, high-amplification

dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
unit: -2,-1,0,1,2: 2 copy del, 1 copy del, no change, amplification, high-amplification
label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_HNSC_gistic2thd
groupTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma

dataProducer: TCGA PANCAN AWG
label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (pancan awg)
description:
TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) somatic mutation data. Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

Somatic mutations calls (even on the same tumor DNA extract) are affected by many factors including library prep, sequencing process, read mapping method, reference genome used, genome annotation, calling algorithms, and ad-hoc pre/postprocessing such as black list genes, target selection regions, and black list samples. This dataset is the best effort made by the TCGA PANCANCER Analysis Working Group. Raw PANCAN mutation data can be downloaded at the url site shown below.
longTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) gene-level non-silent somatic mutation (pancan awg)
name: TCGA_HNSC_mutation
groupTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma

process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_HNSC_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes
groupTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma

notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_LGG_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_LGG_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 Data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3)
description:
TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) gene expression data by agilent array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using Agilent 244K custom gene expression G4502A_07_3 microarrays by the University of North Carolina TCGA genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene level transcription estimates (level 3 data), as in log2 lowess normalized ratio of sample signal to reference signal (cy5/cy3) collapsed by gene. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3 array)
name: TCGA_LGG_G4502A_07_3

process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
longTitle: TCGA adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) gene expression by RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq), pancan normalized
name: TCGA_ACC_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

name: TCGA_ACC_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_ACC_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_ACC_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_ACC_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA kidney renal papillary cell carcinoma (KIRP) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_KIRP_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA kidney renal papillary cell carcinoma (KIRP) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_KIRP_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 Data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3)
description:
TCGA kidney renal papillary cell carcinoma (KIRP) gene expression data by agilent array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using Agilent 244K custom gene expression G4502A_07_3 microarrays by the University of North Carolina TCGA genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene level transcription estimates (level 3 data), as in log2 lowess normalized ratio of sample signal to reference signal (cy5/cy3) collapsed by gene. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA kidney renal papillary cell carcinoma (KIRP) gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3 array)
name: TCGA_KIRP_G4502A_07_3

wrangling_procedure: Data download from https://www.synapse.org/#!Synapse:syn1759392, processed into antibody by sample matrix at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: MDACC
label: protein expression RPPA (RBN)
description: TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) protein expression data for 131 proteins, measured by RPPA (reverse phase protein array) technology. These data have been normalized by RBN (replicate-base normalization) method developed by MDACC. Details: https://www.synapse.org/#!Synapse:syn1750330 and http://bioinformatics.mdanderson.org/main/TCPA:Overview.
longTitle: TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) phospho- or total protein expression by reverse phase protein array (replicate-base normalization)
name: TCGA_LUAD_RPPA_RBN

process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
longTitle: TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) gene expression by RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq), pancan normalized
name: TCGA_LUAD_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
longTitle: TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) gene expression by RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq), pancan normalized
name: TCGA_LUAD_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_LUAD_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_LUAD_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 Data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3)
description:
TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) gene expression data by agilent array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using Agilent 244K custom gene expression G4502A_07_3 microarrays by the University of North Carolina TCGA genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene level transcription estimates (level 3 data), as in log2 lowess normalized ratio of sample signal to reference signal (cy5/cy3) collapsed by gene. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3 array)
name: TCGA_LUAD_G4502A_07_3

wrangling_procedure: Data download from https://www.synapse.org/#!Synapse:syn1759392, processed into antibody by sample matrix at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: MDACC
label: protein expression RPPA (RBN)
description: TCGA bladder urothelial carcinoma (BLCA) protein expression data for 131 proteins, measured by RPPA (reverse phase protein array) technology. These data have been normalized by RBN (replicate-base normalization) method developed by MDACC. process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA bladder urothelial carcinoma (BLCA) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
longTitle: TCGA bladder urothelial carcinoma (BLCA) gene expression by RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq), pancan normalized
name: TCGA_BLCA_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA bladder urothelial carcinoma (BLCA) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_BLCA_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.

name: TCGA_BLCA_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA bladder urothelial carcinoma (BLCA) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_BLCA_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.

label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)

process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA uveal melanoma (UVM) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA uveal melanoma (UVM) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_UVM_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA uveal melanoma (UVM) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_UVM_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.

process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA sarcoma (SARC) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

name: TCGA_SARC_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA sarcoma (SARC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_SARC_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA sarcoma (SARC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_SARC_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.gene.quantification.txt) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: British Columbia Cancer Agency TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaGA)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Genome Analyzer RNA Sequencing platform by the British Columbia Cancer Agency TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in RPKM values (Reads Per Kilobase of exon model per Million mapped reads). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details).

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA acute myeloid leukemia (LAML) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaGA)
name: TCGA_LAML_exp_GA
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes
