process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA acute myeloid leukemia (LAML) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
longTitle: TCGA acute myeloid leukemia (LAML) gene expression by RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq), pancan normalized
name: TCGA_LAML_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.

name: TCGA_LAML_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA acute myeloid leukemia (LAML) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_LAML_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA acute myeloid leukemia (LAML) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_LAML_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Data download from https://www.synapse.org/#!Synapse:syn1759392, processed into antibody by sample matrix at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: MDACC
label: protein expression RPPA (RBN)
description: TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) protein expression data for 131 proteins, measured by RPPA (reverse phase protein array) technology. These data have been normalized by RBN (replicate-base normalization) method developed by MDACC. Details: https://www.synapse.org/#!Synapse:syn1750330 and http://bioinformatics.mdanderson.org/main/TCPA:Overview.
longTitle: TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) phospho- or total protein expression by reverse phase protein array (replicate-base normalization)
name: TCGA_GBM_RPPA_RBN

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 Data download from TCGA DCC, no data transformation is carried out.
dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: gene expression (AffyU133a)
description:
TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) gene expression data by AffyU133a array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix HT Human Genome U133a microarray platform by the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates. Data is in log space. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) gene expression (AffyU133a array)
name: TCGA_GBM_exp_u133a

process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
longTitle: TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) gene expression by RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq), pancan normalized
name: TCGA_GBM_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.

wrangling_procedure: Download .maf file from TCGA DCC, processed into gene by sample matrix at UCSC, stored in the UCSC Xena repository
dataProducer: Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Center
label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (broad)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) somatic mutation data. Sequencing data are generated on a IlluminaGA system. The calls are generated at Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Center using the MuTect method.

Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs, change of start codon, inframe indels) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene-level nonsilent somatic mutation (broad)
name: TCGA_LUSC_mutation_broad_gene

dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: gene expression (AffyU133a)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression data by AffyU133a array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix HT Human Genome U133a microarray platform by the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates. Data is in log space. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression (AffyU133a array)
name: TCGA_LUSC_exp_u133a

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA prostate adenocarcinoma (PRAD) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA prostate adenocarcinoma (PRAD) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_PRAD_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation450k)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation450 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL13534 record. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation450)
name: TCGA_LUSC_hMethyl450

dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: copy number (delete germline cnv)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) segmented copy number variation profile after removing common germline copy number variation.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix Genome-Wide Human SNP Array 6.0 platform at the Broad TCGA genome characterization center. Raw copy numbers were estimated at each of the SNP and copy-number markers. Circular binary segmentation was then used to segment the copy number data. Segments are mapped to hg19 genome assembly at Broad. A fixed set of common germline cnv probes were removed prior to segmentation. Reference to the algorithm used by Broad to produce the dataset: DCC description and nature 2008 .
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) segmented copy number (delete germline cnv)
name: TCGA_LUSC_GSNP6noCNV

label: protein expression RPPA (RBN)
description: The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) protein expression data for 131 proteins, measured by RPPA (reverse phase protein array) technology. These data have been normalized by RBN (replicate-base normalization) method developed by MDACC. Details: https://www.synapse.org/#!Synapse:syn1750330 and http://bioinformatics.mdanderson.org/main/TCPA:Overview.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) phospho- or total protein expression by reverse phase protein array (replicate-base normalization)
name: TCGA_LUNG_RPPA_RBN

label: protein expression RPPA (RBN)
description: The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) protein expression data for 131 proteins, measured by RPPA (reverse phase protein array) technology. These data have been normalized by RBN (replicate-base normalization) method developed by MDACC. Details: https://www.synapse.org/#!Synapse:syn1750330 and http://bioinformatics.mdanderson.org/main/TCPA:Overview.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) phospho- or total protein expression by reverse phase protein array (replicate-base normalization)
name: TCGA_LUNG_RPPA_RBN

dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: copy number segments (delete germline cnv)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) segmented copy number variation profile after removing common germline copy number variation.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix Genome-Wide Human SNP Array 6.0 platform at the Broad TCGA genome characterization center. Raw copy numbers were estimated at each of the SNP and copy-number markers. Circular binary segmentation was then used to segment the copy number data. Segments are mapped to hg19 genome assembly at Broad. A fixed set of common germline cnv probes were removed prior to segmentation. Reference to the algorithm used by Broad to produce the dataset: DCC description and nature 2008 .
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) segmented copy number (delete germline cnv)
name: TCGA_LUSC_GSNP6noCNV_gSeg

dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_LUSC_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
unit: -2,-1,0,1,2: 2 copy del, 1 copy del, no change, amplification, high-amplification
label: copy number (gistic2_thresholded)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) thresholded gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, GISTIC2 method was applied using the TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline to produce gene-level copy number estimates. GISTIC2 further thresholded the estimated values to -2,-1,0,1,2, representing homozygous deletion, single copy deletion, diploid normal copy, low-level copy number amplification, or high-level copy number amplification. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) copy number gistic2_thresholded estimate
name: TCGA_LUSC_gistic2thd

dataProducer: TCGA PANCAN AWG
label: somatic gene-level non-silent mutation (pancan awg)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) somatic mutation data. Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.

Somatic mutations calls (even on the same tumor DNA extract) are affected by many factors including library prep, sequencing process, read mapping method, reference genome used, genome annotation, calling algorithms, and ad-hoc pre/postprocessing such as black list genes, target selection regions, and black list samples. This dataset is the best effort made by the TCGA PANCANCER Analysis Working Group. Raw PANCAN mutation data can be downloaded at the url site shown below.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene-level non-silent somatic mutation (pancan awg)
name: TCGA_LUSC_mutation

process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA cancer genomic characterization center
label: DNA methylation (Methylation27k)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) DNA methylation data.

DNA methylation profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylation27 platform. Beta values were derived at the Johns Hopkins University and University of Southern California TCGA genome characterization center. DNA methylation values, described as beta values, are recorded for each array probe in each sample via BeadStudio software. DNA methylation beta values are continuous variables between 0 and 1, representing the ratio of the intensity of the methylated bead type to the combined locus intensity. Thus higher beta values represent higher level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypermethylation and lower beta values represent lower level of DNA methylation, i.e. hypomethylation. We observed a bimodal distribution of the beta values from both methylation27 and methylation450 platforms, with two peaks around 0.1 and 0.9 and a relatively flat valley around 0.2-0.8. The bimodal distribution is far more pronounced and balanced in methylation450 than methylation27 platform. In the methylation27 platform, the lower beta peak is much stronger than the higher beta peak, while the two peaks are of similar height in the methylation450 platform. The average of the beta values of this dataset is 0.242421397836., thus much of the heatmap appears hypomethylated (blue). Microarray probes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using xena probeMap derived from GEO GPL8490 and GPL13534 records. Here is a reference to Illumina Infinium BeadChip DNA methylation platform beta value.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) DNA methylation (HumanMethylation27)
name: TCGA_LUSC_hMethyl27

process.wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_LUSC_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

label: gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression data by agilent array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using Agilent 244K custom gene expression G4502A_07_3 microarrays by the University of North Carolina TCGA genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3 array)
name: TCGA_LUSC_G4502A_07_3

dataProducer: British Columbia Cancer Agency TCGA genome characterization center
label: miRNA isoform expression (IlluminaHiseq)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) miRNA expression by RNAseq. The miRNA expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the British Columbia Cancer Agency TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. Download data is in the unit of reads per million mapped reads (RPM). This dataset shows the miRNA transcription estimates in log2 (RPM). For more information see: http://nar.oxfordjournals.org/content/early/2015/08/13/nar.gkv808.full .

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each miRNA to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each miRNA across the cohort on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) miRNA isoform expression by RNAseq (IlluminaHiseq)
name: TCGA_LUSC_miRNA_HiSeq

wrangling_procedure: FIREHOSE data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
label: copy number (gistic2)
description:
TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline applied GISTIC2 method to produce segmented CNV data, which was then mapped to genes to produce gene-level estimates. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma (LGG) copy number gistic2 estimate
name: TCGA_LGG_gistic2

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_GBM_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 Data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_1)
description:
TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) gene expression data by agilent array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using Agilent 244K custom gene expression G4502A_07_1 microarrays by the University of North Carolina TCGA genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene level transcription estimates (level 3 data), as in log2 lowess normalized ratio of sample signal to reference signal (cy5/cy3) collapsed by gene. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_1 array)
name: TCGA_GBM_G4502A_07_1

This dataset shows the gene level transcription estimates (level 3 data), as in log2 lowess normalized ratio of sample signal to reference signal (cy5/cy3) collapsed by gene. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_1 array)
name: TCGA_GBM_G4502A_07_1

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_GBM_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: FIREHOSE data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
label: copy number (gistic2)
description:
TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline applied GISTIC2 method to produce segmented CNV data, which was then mapped to genes to produce gene-level estimates. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) copy number gistic2 estimate
name: TCGA_BRCA_gistic2

wrangling_procedure: Data download from https://www.synapse.org/#!Synapse:syn1759392, processed into antibody by sample matrix at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: MDACC
label: protein expression RPPA (RBN)

process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
longTitle: TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) gene expression by RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq), pancan normalized
name: TCGA_BRCA_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_BRCA_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

longTitle: TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_BRCA_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.

name: TCGA_BRCA_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 Data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3)
description:
TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) gene expression data by agilent array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using Agilent 244K custom gene expression G4502A_07_3 microarrays by the University of North Carolina TCGA genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene level transcription estimates (level 3 data), as in log2 lowess normalized ratio of sample signal to reference signal (cy5/cy3) collapsed by gene. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA) gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3 array)
name: TCGA_BRCA_G4502A_07_3

wrangling_procedure: FIREHOSE data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
label: copy number (gistic2)
description:
TCGA prostate adenocarcinoma (PRAD) gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline applied GISTIC2 method to produce segmented CNV data, which was then mapped to genes to produce gene-level estimates. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA prostate adenocarcinoma (PRAD) copy number gistic2 estimate
name: TCGA_PRAD_gistic2

wrangling_procedure: FIREHOSE data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
label: copy number (gistic2)
description:
TCGA prostate adenocarcinoma (PRAD) gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline applied GISTIC2 method to produce segmented CNV data, which was then mapped to genes to produce gene-level estimates. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA prostate adenocarcinoma (PRAD) copy number gistic2 estimate
name: TCGA_PRAD_gistic2

label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_LUNG_exp_HiSeqV2

label: gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene expression data by agilent array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using Agilent 244K custom gene expression G4502A_07_3 microarrays by the University of North Carolina TCGA genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene level transcription estimates (level 3 data), as in log2 lowess normalized ratio of sample signal to reference signal (cy5/cy3) collapsed by gene. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3 array)
name: TCGA_LUNG_G4502A_07_3

label: copy number (gistic2)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline applied GISTIC2 method to produce segmented CNV data, which was then mapped to genes to produce gene-level estimates. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) copy number gistic2 estimate
name: TCGA_LUNG_gistic2
dne: WARNING: mtx does not match gene/patient set.

label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_LUNG_exp_HiSeqV2
dne: WARNING: mtx does not match gene/patient set.

label: gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene expression data by agilent array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using Agilent 244K custom gene expression G4502A_07_3 microarrays by the University of North Carolina TCGA genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene level transcription estimates (level 3 data), as in log2 lowess normalized ratio of sample signal to reference signal (cy5/cy3) collapsed by gene. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3 array)
name: TCGA_LUNG_G4502A_07_3
dne: WARNING: mtx does not match gene/patient set.

cohort: TCGA lower grade glioma and glioblastoma (GBMLGG)
label: copy number (gistic2)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA brain lower grade glioma and glioblastoma multiforme datasets. TCGA brain lower grade glioma and glioblastoma multiforme (GBMLGG) gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline applied GISTIC2 method to produce segmented CNV data, which was then mapped to genes to produce gene-level estimates. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma and glioblastoma multiforme (GBMLGG) copy number gistic2 estimate
name: TCGA_GBMLGG_gistic2
primary_disease: glioblastoma multiforme and brain lower grade glioma

label: copy number (gistic2)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline applied GISTIC2 method to produce segmented CNV data, which was then mapped to genes to produce gene-level estimates. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) copy number gistic2 estimate
name: TCGA_LUNG_gistic2
dne: WARNING: mtx does not match gene/patient set.

label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_LUNG_exp_HiSeqV2
dne: WARNING: mtx does not match gene/patient set.

label: gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene expression data by agilent array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using Agilent 244K custom gene expression G4502A_07_3 microarrays by the University of North Carolina TCGA genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene level transcription estimates (level 3 data), as in log2 lowess normalized ratio of sample signal to reference signal (cy5/cy3) collapsed by gene. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3 array)
name: TCGA_LUNG_G4502A_07_3
dne: WARNING: mtx does not match gene/patient set.

wrangling_procedure: FIREHOSE data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
label: copy number (gistic2)
description:
TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline applied GISTIC2 method to produce segmented CNV data, which was then mapped to genes to produce gene-level estimates. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) copy number gistic2 estimate
name: TCGA_HNSC_gistic2
groupTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma

process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
longTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) gene expression by RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq), pancan normalized
name: TCGA_HNSC_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
groupTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_HNSC_exp_HiSeqV2
groupTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_HNSC_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
groupTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_HNSC_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
groupTitle: TCGA head & neck squamous cell carcinoma
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: FIREHOSE data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline
label: copy number (gistic2)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline applied GISTIC2 method to produce segmented CNV data, which was then mapped to genes to produce gene-level estimates. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) copy number gistic2 estimate
name: TCGA_LUSC_gistic2

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 Data download from TCGA DCC, no data transformation is carried out.
dataProducer: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center
label: gene expression (AffyU133a)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression data by AffyU133a array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Affymetrix HT Human Genome U133a microarray platform by the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard University cancer genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates. Data is in log space. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression (AffyU133a array)
name: TCGA_LUSC_exp_u133a

process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression by RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq), pancan normalized
name: TCGA_LUSC_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression by RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq), pancan normalized
name: TCGA_LUSC_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_LUSC_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

label: copy number (gistic2)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline applied GISTIC2 method to produce segmented CNV data, which was then mapped to genes to produce gene-level estimates. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) copy number gistic2 estimate
name: TCGA_LUNG_gistic2
dne: WARNING: mtx does not match gene/patient set.

label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma datasets. The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung cancer (LUNG) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_LUNG_exp_HiSeqV2
dne: WARNING: mtx does not match gene/patient set.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
name: TCGA_LUSC_exp_HiSeqV2
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are downloaded from TCGA DCC, percentile ranked, and processed at UCSC into Xena repository.
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
description:
For each sample, we rank genes RSEM values between 0% to 100%. This dataset is gene expression estimation in percentile rank, which higher value representing higher expression. The dataset can be used to compare this RNAseq data with other cohorts when the other data is processed in the same way (i.e. percentile ranking). Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression by RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq percentile)
name: TCGA_LUSC_exp_HiSeqV2_percentile
notes: the probeMap is hugo for the short term, however probably around 10% of the gene symbols are not HUGO names, but ENTRE genes

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 Data download from TCGA DCC, processed at UCSC into xena repository
dataProducer: University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center
label: gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3)
description:
TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression data by agilent array.

The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using Agilent 244K custom gene expression G4502A_07_3 microarrays by the University of North Carolina TCGA genomic characterization center. Level 3 interpreted level data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene level transcription estimates (level 3 data), as in log2 lowess normalized ratio of sample signal to reference signal (cy5/cy3) collapsed by gene. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap.

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
longTitle: TCGA lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) gene expression (AgilentG4502A_07_3 array)
name: TCGA_LUSC_G4502A_07_3

cohort: TCGA lower grade glioma and glioblastoma (GBMLGG)
label: copy number (gistic2)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA brain lower grade glioma and glioblastoma multiforme datasets. TCGA brain lower grade glioma and glioblastoma multiforme (GBMLGG) gene-level copy number variation (CNV) estimated using the GISTIC2 method.

Copy number profile was measured experimentally using whole genome microarray at a TCGA genome characterization center. Subsequently, TCGA FIREHOSE pipeline applied GISTIC2 method to produce segmented CNV data, which was then mapped to genes to produce gene-level estimates. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC xena HUGO probeMap. Reference to GISTIC2 method PMID:21527027.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma and glioblastoma multiforme (GBMLGG) copy number gistic2 estimate
name: TCGA_GBMLGG_gistic2
primary_disease: glioblastoma multiforme and brain lower grade glioma

process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.
dataProducer: UCSC Xena team
cohort: TCGA lower grade glioma and glioblastoma (GBMLGG)
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA brain lower grade glioma and glioblastoma multiforme (GBMLGG) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma and glioblastoma multiforme (GBMLGG) gene expression by RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq), pancan normalized
name: TCGA_GBMLGG_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
primary_disease: glioblastoma multiforme and brain lower grade glioma

cohort: TCGA lower grade glioma and glioblastoma (GBMLGG)
label: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)
description:
TCGA brain lower grade glioma and glioblastoma multiforme (GBMLGG) gene expression by RNAseq, mean-normalized (per gene) across all TCGA cohorts. Values in this dataset are generated at UCSC by combining "gene expression RNAseq" values of all TCGA cohorts, values are then mean-centered per gene, then extracting the converted data only belongs to the this cohort.

For comparing data within this cohort, we recommend to use the "gene expression RNAseq" dataset. For questions regarding the gene expression of this particular cohort in relation to other types tumors, you can use the pancan normalized version of the "gene expression RNAseq" data. For comparing with data outside TCGA, we recommend using the percentile version if the non-TCGA data is normalized by percentile ranking. For more information, please see our Data FAQ: here.
longTitle: TCGA brain lower grade glioma and glioblastoma multiforme (GBMLGG) gene expression by RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq), pancan normalized
name: TCGA_GBMLGG_exp_HiSeqV2_PANCAN
primary_disease: glioblastoma multiforme and brain lower grade glioma

process.input: gene expression RNAseq (ployA+ IlluminaHiSeq pancan normalized)

wrangling_procedure: Level_3 data (file names: *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) are download from TCGA DCC, log2(x+1) transformed, normalized across all TCGA cancer cohorts (all *.rsem.genes.normalized_results) per gene, and deposited into UCSC Xena repository.

cohort: TCGA lower grade glioma and glioblastoma (GBMLGG)
label: gene expression RNAseq (polyA+ IlluminaHiSeq)
description:
The dataset is combined from TCGA brain lower grade glioma and glioblastoma multiforme datasets. The gene expression profile was measured experimentally using the Illumina HiSeq 2000 RNA Sequencing platform by the University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center. Level 3 data was downloaded from TCGA data coordination center. This dataset shows the gene-level transcription estimates, as in log2(x+1) transformed RSEM normalized count. Genes are mapped onto the human genome coordinates using UCSC Xena HUGO probeMap (see ID/Gene mapping link below for details). Reference to method description from University of North Carolina TCGA genome characterization center: DCC description

In order to more easily view the differential expression between samples, we set the default view to center each gene or exon to zero by independently subtracting the mean of each gene or exon on the fly. Users can view the original non-normalized values by adjusting visualization settings.
